docs.title: AFNI
docs.description: AFNI (Analysis of Functional NeuroImages) is a leading software suite of C, Python, R programs and shell scripts primarily developed for the analysis and display of multiple MRI modalities: anatomical, functional MRI (FMRI) and diffusion weighted (DW) data. It is freely available (both as open source code and as precompiled binaries) for research purposes. The software is made to run on virtually any Unix system with X11 and Motif displays. Binary packages are provided for MacOS and Linux systems such as Fedora, CentOS/Red Hat and Ubuntu (which includes the Windows Subsystem for Linux).

docs.title: Out file
docs.description: Output image file name.

docs.title: 3dTstat
docs.description: Compute voxel-wise statistics using AFNI 3dTstat command

docs.title: In file
docs.description: Input file to 3dtstat.

docs.title: Mask
docs.description: Mask file.

docs.title: Num threads
docs.description: Set number of threads.

docs.title: Options
docs.description: Selected statistical output.

docs.title: Outputtype
docs.description: 'nifti' or 'afni' or 'nifti_gz'. Afni output filetype.

docs.title: Sum
docs.description: Compute sum of input voxels.

docs.title: Absolute Sum
docs.description: Compute absolute sum of input voxels.

docs.title: Sum of Squares
docs.description: Compute sum of squares.

docs.title: L2 Norm
docs.description: Compute L2 norm (sqrt(sum squares)).

docs.title: Mean
docs.description: Compute mean of input voxels.

docs.title: Slope
docs.description: Compute the slope of input voxels vs. time.

docs.title: Standard Deviation
docs.description: Compute standard deviation of input voxels.

docs.title: Standard Deviation No Detrending
docs.description: Compute standard deviation of input voxels without detrending.

docs.title: Coefficient of Variation
docs.description: Compute coefficient of variation of input voxels.

docs.title: Coefficient of Variation No Detrending
docs.description: Compute coefficient of variation of input voxels without detrending.

docs.title: Inverse Coefficient of Variation
docs.description: Compute inverse coefficient of variation of input voxels.

docs.title: Inverse Coefficient of Variation No Detrending
docs.description: Compute inverse coefficient of variation of input voxels without detrending.

docs.title: Temporal Signal to Noise Ratio
docs.description: Compute temporal signal to noise ratio.

docs.title: Median Absolute Deviation
docs.description: Compute median absolute deviation of input voxels.

docs.title: Durbin-Watson Statistic
docs.description: Compute Durbin-Watson Statistic of input voxels.

docs.title: Median
docs.description: Compute median of input voxels.

docs.title: Non-Zero Median
docs.description: Compute median of non-zero input voxels.

docs.title: Non-Zero Standard Deviation
docs.description: Compute standard deviation of non-zero input voxels.

docs.title: Biweight Midvariance
docs.description: Compute biweight midvariance of input voxels.

docs.title: Mean of Successive Squared Differences
docs.description: Compute mean of successive squared differences of input voxels.

docs.title: Square Root of MSSD
docs.description: Compute square root of mean of successive squared differences of input voxels.

docs.title: Median of Absolute Values of First Time Differences
docs.description: Compute median of absolute values of first time differences of input voxels.

docs.title: Minimum
docs.description: Compute minimum of input voxels.

docs.title: Maximum
docs.description: Compute maximum of input voxels.

docs.title: Absolute Maximum
docs.description: Compute absolute maximum of input voxels.

docs.title: Signed Absolute Maximum
docs.description: Compute signed absolute maximum of input voxels.

docs.title: Percentile
docs.description: Compute the P-th percentile point of the data in each voxel time series.

docs.title: Index of Minimum
docs.description: Compute index of minimum of input voxels.

docs.title: Index + 1 of Minimum
docs.description: Compute index + 1 of minimum of input voxels.

docs.title: Index of Maximum
docs.description: Compute index of maximum of input voxels.

docs.title: Index + 1 of Maximum
docs.description: Compute index + 1 of maximum of input voxels.

docs.title: Index of Absolute Maximum
docs.description: Compute index of absolute maximum of input voxels.

docs.title: Index + 1 of Absolute Maximum
docs.description: Compute index + 1 of absolute maximum of input voxels.

docs.title: Duration
docs.description: Compute number of points around max above a threshold.

docs.title: Onset
docs.description: Compute beginning of duration around max where value exceeds basepercent.

docs.title: Offset
docs.description: Compute end of duration around max where value exceeds basepercent.

docs.title: Centroid
docs.description: Compute centroid of data time curves.

docs.title: Centroid Duration
docs.description: Compute duration using centroid's index as center.

docs.title: Non-Zero Mean
docs.description: Compute mean of non-zero voxels.

docs.title: Zero Count
docs.description: Count number of zero values at each voxel.

docs.title: Non-Zero Count
docs.description: Count number of non-zero values at each voxel.

docs.title: Autocorrelation
docs.description: Compute autocorrelation function and return first n coefficients.

docs.title: Autoregression
docs.description: Compute autoregression coefficients and return first n coefficients.

docs.title: Accumulate
docs.description: Accumulate time series values (partial sums).

docs.title: Centromean
docs.description: Compute mean of middle 50% of voxel values.

docs.title: Skewness
docs.description: Measure of asymmetry in distribution.

docs.title: Kurtosis
docs.description: Measure of the 'tailedness' of the probability distribution.

docs.title: First Value
docs.description: First value in dataset.

docs.title: First Difference
docs.description: Take the first difference of each time series before further processing.

docs.title: Prefix
docs.description: Use string 'p' for the prefix of the output dataset [DEFAULT = 'stat'].

docs.title: Datum
docs.description: Use data type 'd' for the type of storage of the output, where 'd' is one of 'byte', 'short', or 'float' [DEFAULT=float].

docs.title: No Scale
docs.description: Do not scale output values when datum is byte or short. Scaling is done by default.

docs.title: Base Percent
docs.description: Percentage of maximum for duration calculation.

docs.title: Mask Mset
docs.description: Use the dataset 'mset' as a mask. Only voxels with nonzero values in 'mset' will be printed from 'dataset'.

docs.title: Mask Range
docs.description: Further restrict the voxels from 'mset' so that only those mask values between 'a' and 'b' (inclusive) will be used.

docs.title: Cmask
docs.description: Execute the options enclosed in single quotes as a 3dcalc-like program, and produce a mask from the resulting 3D brick.

docs.title: 3dTstat
docs.description: Compute voxel-wise statistics using AFNI 3dTstat command
